name: deprive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone: He claimed that he had been deprived of his freedom/rights. You can't function properly when you're deprived of sleep.
More examplesFewer examplesSome parents deprive themselves of many pleasures so that their children can have the best of everything.He complained that his captors had deprived him of his basic human rights.If you deprive a child of affection, they can become very withdrawn.He pulled me from the table and hurried me into the car, depriving me of my lunch!I've been deprived of your company for too long - come and see me soon.
